qas.question: Which side of the Cold War was Sadat?

answers.text: surprise attack to regain part of the Sinai territory Israel had captured 6 years earlier

qas.question: What did Sadat exchange for the remainder of Sinai?

context: In <a0_0>1970<a0_0/>, President Nasser died and was succeeded by <a1_0>Anwar Sadat<a1_0/>. Sadat switched Egypt's Cold War allegiance from the Soviet Union to the <a2_0>United States,<a2_0/> expelling Soviet advisors in 1972. He launched the Infitah economic reform policy, while clamping down on religious and secular opposition. In 1973, Egypt, along with Syria, launched the October War, a <a3_0>surprise attack to regain part of the Sinai territory Israel had captured 6 years earlier<a3_0/>. it presented Sadat with a victory that allowed him to regain the Sinai later in return for <a4_0>peace with Israel<a4_0/>.
